script.title: Exa's $700M Unicorn Path: The Peter Fenton Signal

key_segments.text: Benchmark partner just broke his firm's rules. $50 million reasons why.
key_segments.visual_direction: Tight talking head, direct camera, zoom in

key_segments.text: Peter Fenton. Seven IPOs. Early Twitter. Early Yelp. Benchmark partner. Benchmark's playbook? Early stage deals, fifteen million max.
September 2025. Peter invests fifty million. Personally. In a late-stage deal. He joined the board. That's not the Benchmark playbook.
key_segments.visual_direction: Talking head, lean in, slow push-in

key_segments.text: The company? Exa. AI search engine. Built for AI agents, not humans. Google uses keywords. Exa uses neural networks to predict which links humans share. It's called Neural PageRank.
key_segments.visual_direction: Split screen - Google vs Exa comparison

key_segments.text: YC 2021. Seven hundred million valuation. Four years. Ninety percent on benchmarks. Highest in market. Customers? Cursor, Databricks, AWS, Vercel.
When top VCs break patterns, there's signal. Follow for more.
key_segments.visual_direction: Direct camera, point to follow button
